intro: Maytenus officinalis, commonly known as the sacred tree or the quina tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, orange-colored berries that are often used in traditional medicine. It is valued for its medicinal properties, particularly for its use in treating fevers and other ailments. The tree is also noted for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in humid, tropical climates.
